RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: possui graduao em Engenharia Eletrnica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1984), mestrado em Engenharia Eletrnica e Computao pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1988) e doutorado em Electrical Engineering pela University of Colorado at Boulder (1994). Atualmente pesquisador em cincia e tecnologia e membro da Diviso de Projetos do Departamento de Cincia e Tecnologia Aeroespacial do Comando da Aeronutica. Tem experincia na rea de Engenharia Eltrica, com nfase em Instrumentao Eletrnica, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: giroscpio a fibra ptica, sinal interferomtrico, anlise de sinais discretos, fibras pticas e transformada rpida de Fourier. Atua tambm em gesto de projetos e portflios de CT&I, especialmente na utilizao de Sistemas de Informaes Gerenciais de projetos.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduated in Eletronics Engineering from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1984), got a master's degree in Electrial Engineering from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1988) and a doctorate degree in Electrical Engineering from University of Colorado at Boulder (1994). He is presently a researcher and administrator at the Project Division of the Departamento de Cincia e Tecnologia Aeroespacial do Comando da Aeronutica. He has experience in Electrical Engineering, especially in the following areas: Electronic Instrumentation, acting on the following subjects: optical fiber giroscope, fiber optics, interferometry and digital signal processing. He also has esperience and works in poject and portfolio management, focusing on Management Information Systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Measurements of polarization cross-coupling in a polarization-maintaining fiber (3M FS-PM-6621) under two coiling situations are carried out by optical coherence domain polarimetry. In the first situation, it is coiled around a 25.4 mm diameter piezoelectric tube and the applied voltage is increased from 0 to 900 V. In the second, the fiber is tension-coiled around a 24.6 mm diameter passive drum and the tension increased from 0 to 3.74 N. Measured polarization cross-coupling along the fiber increases 25-30 dB in the coiled region and does not show significant change as voltage or tension is increased in each case.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: A technique is developed to measure with high precision the proper frequency and the modulation index of an interferometric fiber-optic gyro. The technique is based on the principle of secondary sinusoidal modulation and yields measurements with six significant digits. A computer data acquisition system and simple Fast Fourier Transform are used to analyze the behavior of the first harmonic of the gyro signal, for the proper frequency measurement, and the second harmonic for the modulation index measurement. The method relies in the ability to apply secondary modulation with very precise frequencies (seven digits or greater). The accuracy of the proper frequency measurement is dependent of generators frequencies alone, and the index measurement is also dependent of the amplitude accuracy of the generators. In the experiment, a laboratory gyro comprising an integrated optics chip and polarization maintaining fiber is phase modulated by two sinusoidal generators with frequencies adjustable with eight digits precision. Results obtained are: proper frequency, (91107.2 0.4) Hz; frequency where the modulation index due the second generator is equal to the first root of the Bessel function of first kind and zeroth order, (92310.0 0.3) Hz, thus giving a half-wave voltage of (4.251 0.002) Volts.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract An analysis is made of several different coil architectures available to assembly the fiber loop of a fiber optic gyroscope, including straight winding, dipole, quadrupole, octupole, and many others. For each number of layers from 1 to 32, a suitable architecture is proposed to minimize the pointing error due to both radial and longitudinal linear gradients of the refractive index induced by environmental perturbations. Sensitivities to winding errors are determined. A programmable machine capable of winding the fiber with a very low tension in any of the proposed architectures is conceived, assembled, and used to build a 10 cm diameter coil with 1 km of polarization maintaining fiber.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo Este documento formula uma especificao preliminar de eletrnica de processamento de sinal para o modelo de desenvolvimento de um giroscpio a fibra ptica, que visa atender os seguintes requisitos: fundo de escala de 30 graus/segundo, resoluo e estabilidade de deriva de 0,3 graus/hora, estabilidade do fator de escala de 50 ppm e taxa de amostragem da velocidade de rotao de 100 Hz.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: Este Relatrio descreve o Projeto Sensores pticos, coordenado pelo Centro Tcnico Aeroespacial (CTA) e gerido pelo Instituto de Estudos Avanados (IEAv), aberto em janeiro de 1993 e encerrado em dezembro de 1999. O principal resultado deste Projeto foi a implantao da atividade de pesquisa em Sensores a Fibra ptica no IEAv, promovendo a formao e aperfeioamento de recursos humanos de alto nvel, instalando e aparelhando os recursos de infra-estrutura, desenvolvendo recursos tecnolgicos diversos, adquirindo recursos materiais e de informao variados, e criando uma considervel capacidade tcnico-cientfica para o desenvolvimento de sensores de rotao a fibra ptica para aplicao aeroespacial. A documentao do Projeto compreende 130 documentos, a saber: 06 teses de doutorado, 12 teses de mestrado, 10 trabalhos de graduao, 26 artigos em peridicos, 40 apresentaes em eventos tcnico-cientficos, 04 patentes, 09 relatrios e 28 fichas informativas de projeto.
